html: Are come forth out of the waters of Judah "Ye that flow from the fountain of Judah"— ,ממי , mimmey, "from the waters." Perhaps ,ממעי , mimmeey, "from the bowels," So many others have conjectured, or ,יהודה מני , meni yehudah, or ,מיהודה , meyhudah, "from Judah."—Secker. But see Michaelis in Praelect, not. 22. And we have ,יעקב עין , eyn yaakob, "the fountain of Jacob," Deuteronomy 33:28, and ,ישראל ממקור , mimmekor yishrael, "from the fountain of Israel," Psalm 68:27. Twenty-seven MSS. of Kennicott's, six of De Rossi's and two of my own, with six editions, have ,מימי , meymey, "from the days;" which makes no good sense.
